2022 Outlook
Depth Chart
There was a hot debate heading into the 2021 season between those supporting Dalton Schultz and those supporting Blake Jarwin. Practically everyone agreed that the Cowboys' tight end position had some excellent potential heading into the year, but a split tight end situation is rarely great for fantasy production. Jarwin struggled to stay on the field for the second straight season which gave Schultz an opportunity to run as the unquestioned TE1 in Dallas.

Schultz responded by ending the debate, delivering the fourth-most fantasy points at tight end in standard scoring formats. His 808 receiving yards were sixth-most at the position and his eight touchdowns were fifth-most, narrowly finishing behind Mark Andrews, Travis Kelce, Hunter Henry, and Dawson Knox who all had nine touchdowns.

Now heading into his third season as the Cowboys' top tight end, there's some serious potential for an even bigger year from Schultz, particularly early in the year. The Cowboys losing both Amari Cooper and Cedrick Wilson, along with likely being without Michael Gallup to start the season, means that the team will really only have two pass catchers - CeeDee Lamb and Dalton Schultz - on the roster who have any real history of production in the NFL. Schultz finished the 2021 season with the sixth-most total targets at the tight end position and that was when he was competing with much better receivers for passes.

Don't expect a Travis Kelce-like season from Schultz, but an even higher target share in a good Dallas offense should lead to a high floor for those investing in him in fantasy. Schultz is a safe option who could be a legitimate needle mover this season, especially early in the year.

News From The Past 90 Days
Dalton Schultz dealing with PCL injury
TE uncertain for Week 3
By: Doug Orth | Tue Sep 20, 12:20 am

Cowboys coach Mike McCarthy confirmed the team feels “good about the scan” today for TE Dalton Schultz. Team won’t know whether Schultz will be available next Monday at Giants until leading up closer to game. (Michael Gehlken on Twitter)

FFToday's Take: While the team might feel good about the scan, most fantasy managers will not have the luxury of waiting for the Cowboys to decide if he can play in Week 3 with their game being on Monday against the Giants. Even if he does play, it is hard to imagine he will be effective with a similar injury to the one that bothered Ezekiel Elliott most of last season. Jake Ferguson would most likely start in his place if he sits, but it is very likely there are better options available on the wire.

2022 Outlook
Depth Chart
Hooper is an athletic pass catcher who was limited by the TE tandem used in Cleveland. It wasn't that long ago that Hooper was catching 70+ balls a season for the Falcons in 2018 and 2019. He also pulled in 16 TD passes in four years in Atlanta.

With A.J. Brown and Julio Jones gone, Robert Woods recovering from ACL surgery, rookie Treylon Burks off to a slow start, and Nick Westbrook-Ikhine yet to prove himself, it's not out of the realm of possibility for Hooper to start the season as the No.2 receiving option in this offense. He's a big target, with reliable hands and can be a high-volume receiver for Ryan Tannehill in the middle of the field in a ball-control attack. He's a borderline TE1.

Depth Chart
With Noah Fant included in the trade package for Wilson, Okwuegbunam is expected to function as the No. 1 tight end in 2022, though the selection of Greg Dulich in the third round at least serves to muddy the waters a bit. Physically, there's a lot to like about Okwuegbunam, who has an ideal combination of size and speed for the position. The numbers haven't been there, going back to his time at Mizzou, but he made strides last year, finishing with a 33-330-2 line. When you consider that Fant had 68 catches to replace, it's easy to see why Okwuegbunam could have some sleeper potential. If you play in a league large enough to carry two tight ends, Okwuegbunam makes a lot of sense as a backup.

Broncos Depth Chart
News From The Past 90 Days
Albert Okwuegbunam on the verge of breaking out?
Potential replacement for Tim Patrick
By: Doug Orth | Tue Aug 9, 11:30 pm

The Broncos seem poised to use a cast of many to replace Tim Patrick, who tore his ACL last week. But most prominent among those is tight end Albert Okwuegbunam, who is frequently on the receiving end of Russell Wilson’s passes. His gift is in getting separation outside and finding gaps in zone coverage, especially down the seam. “Earlier on in OTAs, picking up the system took him a while,” HC Nathaniel Hackett said. “He’s been absolutely splendid going out there right now. He’s been going out there and we’ve been putting him all over the place, from motioning, playing wide, playing ‘F’ and doing all kinds of different things.” (104.3 The Fan - Andrew Mason)

FFToday's Take: Albert O was shaping up to be a trendy sleeper pick in early drafts until reports of rookie Greg Dulchich's supposed rise surfaced. However, Patrick's injury has pretty much guaranteed that Okwuegbunam will play regardless. Based on Hackett's comments, it would seem as though Okwuegbunam will play as much as possible. With Russell Wilson as his quarterback and his eye-popping athleticism, do not be surprised if Okwuegbunam emerges as the next big thing at tight end in fantasy.

Sammy Watkins Out for Week 3
Hamstring injury
By: Mike Krueger | Fri Sep 23, 4:12 pm

Sammy Watkins will not have an encore this week to his 3 catches, 93 yards. He has been ruled out vs. Bucs because of his hamstring injury. David Bakhtiari is questionable for 3rd straight week. Randall Cobb (illness), Christian Watson (hamstring), Marcedes Lewis (groin) also questionable. Mason Crosby (illness) was dropped from injury report. Elgton Jenkins also dropped from injury report. He’s in good shape. (Ryan Wood on Twitter)

FFToday's Take: The good news is Alan Lazard (ankle) did practice on Friday and is expected to play although the matchup isn't great against a Bucs secondary only allowed 1 TD to the wide receiver position in two games. We could see increased usage for Romeo Doubs this week.

News From The Past 90 Days
Depth Chart
Zach Ertz limited in practice Friday, Questionable
Could be on a snap count if he plays
By: Mike Krueger | Fri Sep 9, 6:00 pm

The Cardinals will also have a better idea of the status of Cody Ford later today, Kliff Kingsbury said. Kingsbury hopes TE Zach Ertz and LB Markus Golden can contribute on Sunday "in some manner" but he's not sure if it'll be the entire game. (Josh Weinfuss on Twitter)

FFToday's Take: Sounds like Ertz would be limited even if he does suit up against the Chiefs making him a player to avoid in Week 1. Maxx Williams, Trey McBride and Stephen Anderson are next up on the depth chart but uncertain roles keep them off the fantasy radar.

Zach Ertz still nursing calf injury
TE will be day-to-day this week
By: Doug Orth | Mon Sep 5, 7:30 pm

TE Zach Ertz also going to be day to day this week, Kingsbury said. (Darren Urban on Twitter)

FFToday's Take: While Ertz has been dealing with this injury for about a month, the day-to-day designation suggests he is more likely than not to play in Week 1 against the Chiefs. Considering how much practice he has missed, it may be a bit much to ask him to serve as a fantasy TE1 despite how much he is needed with DeAndre Hopkins serving his season-opening six-game suspension. If Ertz cannot go, fantasy managers in deeper leagues could realistically pivot to 2022 second-round draft pick Trey McBride.

Dalton Schultz dealing with PCL injury
TE uncertain for Week 3
By: Doug Orth | Tue Sep 20, 12:20 am

Cowboys coach Mike McCarthy confirmed the team feels “good about the scan” today for TE Dalton Schultz. Team won’t know whether Schultz will be available next Monday at Giants until leading up closer to game. (Michael Gehlken on Twitter)

FFToday's Take: While the team might feel good about the scan, most fantasy managers will not have the luxury of waiting for the Cowboys to decide if he can play in Week 3 with their game being on Monday against the Giants. Even if he does play, it is hard to imagine he will be effective with a similar injury to the one that bothered Ezekiel Elliott most of last season. Jake Ferguson would most likely start in his place if he sits, but it is very likely there are better options available on the wire.

2022 Outlook
Depth Chart
Longtime Bengals tight end C.J. Uzomah had the most productive season of his career in 2021 when he connected with Joe Burrow for 49 receptions, 493 yards and five scores, all of which were career highs. The Bengals opted to not re-sign Uzomah, however, and the tight end now finds himself in New York with the Jets, helping to bring some veteran experience to an otherwise extremely young and inexperienced group of offensive playmakers.

Uzomah was not the only tight end that the Jets brought in, however, as they also signed former Vikings tight end Tyler Conklin to a deal. Conklin signed a three-year, $20.25 million contract with $10 million guaranteed, which is a little less than what Uzomah got at three years, $24 million with $15 million in guarantees. This discrepancy isn't significant in the grand scheme of things so we shouldn't be completely certain that Uzomah is going to be the top tight end on the roster, but teams typically give us some pretty good insights into their thinking when they make financial decisions like these.

Realistically, this is probably going to be a committee approach at the tight end position which isn't going to give us much fantasy value. Sure, Uzomah might see more targets this year, but what's that going to give us? 40 catches? This is a situation to avoid in a bad offense with better, younger pass catching weapons out wide.

Bucs add veteran tight end Kyle Rudolph
32 year-old adds depth to tight end room
By: Mike Krueger | Thu Jul 21, 8:00 am

The Bucs reportedly are signing veteran tight end Kyle Rudolph to a one-year deal, helping fill the void created by the recent retirement of Rob Gronkowski. Both ESPN and the NFL Network reported late Wednesday the Bucs had added Rudolph. (Tampa Bay Times)

FFToday's Take: Rudolph is 32 years old and gives some depth to the Bucs tight end room that includes Cameron Brate and rookies Cade Otton and Ko Kieft. All but Brate are off the fantasy radar.

2022 Outlook
Depth Chart
Jordan flashed with 20 catches in nine games in 2021 and had at least four targets in four of those nine contests. Word out of Houston is that he is the likely starter at TE out of camp this year, and the short and intermediate passing game off play action could be a significant part of this run-first attack. That could mean some volume targets for the second-year project, and if Nico Collins doesn't develop as hoped, Jordan could become a No.2 option in the passing game. Still, he's outside of fantasy consideration to start the season.

Bucs add veteran tight end Kyle Rudolph
32 year-old adds depth to tight end room
By: Mike Krueger | Thu Jul 21, 8:00 am

The Bucs reportedly are signing veteran tight end Kyle Rudolph to a one-year deal, helping fill the void created by the recent retirement of Rob Gronkowski. Both ESPN and the NFL Network reported late Wednesday the Bucs had added Rudolph. (Tampa Bay Times)

FFToday's Take: Rudolph is 32 years old and gives some depth to the Bucs tight end room that includes Cameron Brate and rookies Cade Otton and Ko Kieft. All but Brate are off the fantasy radar.

Zach Ertz limited in practice Friday, Questionable
Could be on a snap count if he plays
By: Mike Krueger | Fri Sep 9, 6:00 pm

The Cardinals will also have a better idea of the status of Cody Ford later today, Kliff Kingsbury said. Kingsbury hopes TE Zach Ertz and LB Markus Golden can contribute on Sunday "in some manner" but he's not sure if it'll be the entire game. (Josh Weinfuss on Twitter)

FFToday's Take: Sounds like Ertz would be limited even if he does suit up against the Chiefs making him a player to avoid in Week 1. Maxx Williams, Trey McBride and Stephen Anderson are next up on the depth chart but uncertain roles keep them off the fantasy radar.

News From The Past 90 Days
Depth Chart
Keenan Allen Out for Week 4
Hamstring injury
By: Mike Krueger | Fri Sep 30, 4:18 pm

WR Keenan Allen (hamstring) is OUT vs. Texans. Brandon Staley said plan is for Donald Parham to sit this weekend and return next week vs. Browns. Wants to make sure Parham is in proper football shape. Today was Parham’s first day back practicing fully. (Daniel Popper on Twitter)

FFToday's Take: This will be the third game Allen has missed after suffering a hamstring injury in Week 1. Mike Williams, Josh Palmer and DeAndre Carter will be the top three wideouts for Justin Herbert (ribs) against the Texans. Allen left practice early Thursday and didn't practice Friday which isn't a great sign for his availability in Week 5.

Just Herbert, Keenan Allen listed as Questionable
Gametime decisions
By: Mike Krueger | Fri Sep 23, 4:29 pm

WR Keenan Allen (hamstring), RT Trey Pipkins (ankle) and TE Donald Parham (hamstring) are questionable for Sunday along with Justin Herbert. CB J.C. Jackson (ankle) and C Corey Linsley (knee) are doubtful. Chase Daniel will start if Justin Herbert can’t go, Brandon Staley said. (Daniel Popper on Twitter)

FFToday's Take: The total on the Charges-Jaguars as dropped from LAC -7 earlier today to LAC -3.0 indicating Vegas doesn't think Herbert is going to play. They will put Herbert through a workout on Sunday before determining his status. Allen is also questionable to play after sustaining a hamstring injury in Week 1.

Justin Herbert, Keenan Allen "day to day" per Staley
Herbert will participate in individual drills Wednesday
By: Mike Krueger | Wed Sep 21, 3:49 pm

Justin Herbert is “day to day” per Brandon Staley. Herbert threw yesterday and did some “rotational” work. He will participate in individual drills today, according to Staley. WR Keenan Allen (hamstring), TE Donald Parham (hamstring), C Corey Linsley (knee) and RT Trey Pipkins (ankle/foot) are all “day to day” per Brandon Staley. (Daniel Popper on Twitter)

FFToday's Take: Herbert suffered a rib in Week 2 and it remains to be seen if he will play in Week 3 against the Jaguars. Allen's hamstring injury occurred in Week 1. We'll know more about all the Chargers' wounded later in the week.

Keenan Allen ruled out for Week 2
Hamstring injury
By: Mike Krueger | Wed Sep 14, 2:50 pm

WR Keenan Allen (hamstring) and TE Donald Parham (hamstring) are OUT for Thursday night vs. Chiefs. CB J.C. Jackson (ankle) is QUESTIONABLE. (Daniel Popper on Twitter)

FFToday's Take: Allen injured his hamstring Week 1 and wasn't likely to play this week against the Chiefs given the short turnaround in Week 2. Mike Williams, Josh Palmer and DeAndre Carter will be the top three wideouts for Justin Herbert in a potential shootout. The Chiefs will be without rookie cornerback Trent McDuffie (hamstring).

George Kittle misses practice Wednesday, groin injury
49ers TE suffered groin injury on Monday
By: Mike Krueger | Wed Sep 7, 3:55 pm

#49ers TE George Kittle has a groin injury, suffered in Monday’s practice, per Kyle Shanahan. Kittle is not practicing today. Unclear right now if it will keep him out this week. (Nick Wagoner on Twitter)

FFToday's Take: HC Kyle Shanahan categorized Kittle as "day-to-day". If Kittle is unable to go this week, Ross Dwelley and Charlie Woerner are the backup tight ends but won't be fantasy options.

News From The Past 90 Days
Sammy Watkins Out for Week 3
Hamstring injury
By: Mike Krueger | Fri Sep 23, 4:12 pm

Sammy Watkins will not have an encore this week to his 3 catches, 93 yards. He has been ruled out vs. Bucs because of his hamstring injury. David Bakhtiari is questionable for 3rd straight week. Randall Cobb (illness), Christian Watson (hamstring), Marcedes Lewis (groin) also questionable. Mason Crosby (illness) was dropped from injury report. Elgton Jenkins also dropped from injury report. He’s in good shape. (Ryan Wood on Twitter)

FFToday's Take: The good news is Alan Lazard (ankle) did practice on Friday and is expected to play although the matchup isn't great against a Bucs secondary only allowed 1 TD to the wide receiver position in two games. We could see increased usage for Romeo Doubs this week.

News From The Past 90 Days
Amon-Ra St. Brown, D'Andre Swift miss practice Thursday
Ankle injury for ASB
By: Mike Krueger | Thu Sep 29, 4:03 pm

#Lions WR Amon-Ra St. Brown (ankle) and RB D'Andre Swift (ankle+ shoulder) missed practice for a second straight day. Pro Bowl G Jonah Jackson (finger), WR D.J. Chark (ankle) and K Austin Seibert (groin) also were out. (Ari Meirov on Twitter)

FFToday's Take: We're expecting Swift to miss this week based on comments by head coach Dan Campbell earlier in the week. The Lions are dealing with multiple injuries at wide receiver and could be depleted at the position in their matchup against the Seahawks. Josh Reynolds may have some Flex value if ASB sits.
